title: Revolution Part 7 - Music & Harmony
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: The role of harmony in revolution - both musical and social. Revolution is not about violence but achieving a new harmony, like retuning an instrument

jefferson_on_harmony.restore_harmony: Let us restore to social intercourse that harmony and affection without which liberty and even life itself are but dreary things
jefferson_on_harmony.religious_intolerance: Having banished religious intolerance, we gain little if we countenance political intolerance
jefferson_on_harmony.music_taste: Mr. Jefferson had a most decided taste for music and great natural dispositions for it
jefferson_on_harmony.voice: His voice was sweet and clear and continued unbroken to a very late period of his life
jefferson_on_harmony.freedom_and_harmony: I expect steady conduct will rally to a proper system - great good to the cause of Freedom & Harmony

three_forms.will_of_every_one: As in England slightly, and in our states greatly
three_forms.government_of_force: All other monarchies and most republics - wolves over sheep

jefferson_on_government.best_form: Not clear the first condition (no government) is not the best, but inconsistent with large population
jefferson_on_government.second_form_assessment: Has evils (turbulence) but weigh against monarchy oppression - becomes nothing
jefferson_on_government.latin_maxim: Malo periculosam, libertatem quam quietam servitutem (I prefer dangerous liberty to peaceful servitude)
jefferson_on_government.rebellion_medicine: A little rebellion now and then is a good thing - medicine necessary for sound health of government

hamilton_vs_jefferson.jeffersons_trinity: Bacon, Newton, Locke - three greatest men the world ever produced
hamilton_vs_jefferson.hamiltons_response: The greatest man that ever lived was Julius Caesar
hamilton_vs_jefferson.jeffersons_assessment: Adams was honest as politician and man; Hamilton honest as man but believed in force or corruption to govern

exercise.action: Hum loudly (hmmm) or make high pitched 'eee' sound
exercise.phenomenon: Sound bounces off each other, giving more volume
exercise.name: Harmony

harmony_phenomenon.scaling: The more people doing it, the louder it gets

revolution_as_retuning.core_concept: Revolution is not about violence - it is about achieving a new Harmony
revolution_as_retuning.gandhi_example: Revolution does not have to be violent, as shown by Gandhi
revolution_as_retuning.reality_check: Government often becomes violent, then people struggle to resist revenge/pre-emptive attacks
revolution_as_retuning.jefferson_conflict: Some considered him Anarchist; he realized he created moments of Anarchy to achieve Harmony
revolution_as_retuning.american_revolution: Was a time of Anarchy - British Monarchy had little or no control of population
revolution_as_retuning.constitutional_evolution: Articles of Confederation written first, replaced by US Constitution

purpose.quote: Song is an enormous force for communications with the masses
purpose.breaks_barriers: Breaks down barriers like illiteracy that impede dialogue with the people

characteristics.evokes_emotions: May evoke emotions, especially about loss
characteristics.speaks_to_regular_people: That is what Revolutionary music should do

examples.american: The Star Spangled Banner - important to American Revolution
examples.mexican: La Cucaracha (The Cockroach) - important to Mexican Revolution
examples.soviet: Communist Music - extensive catalog from Soviet Union

closing_wisdom.jefferson_prayer: Cherish mutual good will, promote harmony and conciliation
closing_wisdom.above_all: Let the love of our country soar above all minor passions
closing_wisdom.french_phrase: Apres Moi le Deluge (After me, the flood)

quiz_questions.q: According to @marsresident, what is Revolution really about?
quiz_questions.a: Not violence - achieving a new Harmony, like retuning an instrument
quiz_questions.explanation: Gandhi showed revolution doesn't have to be violent

quiz_questions.q: What is the harmony phenomenon described?
quiz_questions.a: Multiple people hitting same pitch - sound bounces, amplifies, creates harmony
quiz_questions.explanation: The more people doing it, the louder it gets

quiz_questions.q: What did Jefferson say about rebellion?
quiz_questions.a: A little rebellion now and then is a good thing - medicine for sound health of government
quiz_questions.explanation: Latin: Malo periculosam libertatem quam quietam servitutem

quiz_questions.q: What were Jefferson's three forms of government?
quiz_questions.a: 1) No government (Indians), 2) Will of everyone (America), 3) Government of force (monarchies)
quiz_questions.explanation: Jefferson wasn't sure the first wasn't best, but incompatible with large population

quiz_questions.q: What is the purpose of revolutionary music according to Holden/Zolov?
quiz_questions.a: Enormous force for communication - breaks barriers like illiteracy to reach the people
quiz_questions.explanation: Examples: Star Spangled Banner, La Cucaracha, Soviet anthems
